name: Log to Console
info: Log info to the developers console (F12 in Chrome).

name: Variables
info: Variables don't have static typing, they only have the types var, let & const.

name: Arrays
info: Arrays are datatypes that hold more than one value. In js these variables can have different types.

name: Prompt
info: Prompts the user for data, then returns that data.

name: Date
content:
var date = new Date(year, month, day, hours, minutes, seconds, milliseconds); // Use given date as reference
var date = new Date(); // Uses now

date.getDate(); // Returns day of the month (1 - 31)
date.getDay(); // Returns day of the week (1-7)
date.getFullYear(); // Returns the current year
date.getHours(); // Returns the current hours (0 - 23)
date.getMinutes(); // Returns the current minutes (0 - 59)
date.getMonth(); // Returns the current month (0-11)
date.getSeconds(); // Returns the current seconds (0-59)

name: Math
content:
var x = Math.PI; // Returns 3.1415...
var y = Math.sqrt(16); // Returns 4
var p = Math.pow(4, 2); // Returns 16
var z = Math.random(); // Returns a random number between 0 and 1
var q = Math.round(123.45) // Returns 123 (0.5 rounds up)

name: Functions
Element Selectors
content:
var element = document.getElementById("IdOfElement"); element.style.background = "yellow" // Set the elements background to yellow element.innerText = "hello"; // Set the elements text to hello element.innerHTML = "

Some text

"; // Set the elements child html to

Some text

name: Events
info: Use events to call JS functions in HTML.
content:
// Example HTML code
<form onsubmit="SetElement(this)"></form> // onsubmit is the event

// To call a function use the html attributes listed here, use the style event="functionname()"
onmouseover // Mouse is on the element
onmouseout // Mouse moved out of the element
mousedown // Mouse clicked on the element
mouseup // Mouse released the click on the element
dblclick // Mouse double clicked on the element
mousemove // Mouse moved over the element
click // Mouse clicked on the element
keydown // A keypress happend
keyup // A key got released
submit // Submited a form
reset // Reset a form to its default value
focus // An element gets the focus
blur // An element loses its focus
load // An element is loaded
unload // An element is no longer loaded
resize // The dimensions of an element have changed

name: Logic Operators
content:
<  // Smaller than
>  // Greater than
<=  // Smaller than or equal to
>=  // Greater than or equal to
!=  // Not equal to
===  // Same value and same type
==  // Same value
!==  // Not the same value or same type
isNaN(x)  // Is not a number aka string array ...
x && y  // And gate between X and Y
x & y  // AND gate between X and Y (bitwise)
x || y  // OR gate between X and Y

name: If Statement
Switch
info: Short notation for a repeating if statment.

name: For Loop
info: A loop that loops its code a set ammount of times.

name: While Loop
info: A loop that loops until a condition is met.

name: String methods
content:
var str = "Hello world!";
str.length; // Returns the amount of chars in the string
str.replace("Hello", "Goodnight"); // Returns the string but replaces the word Hello with Goodnight
str.toUpperCase(); // Every letter is now uppercase
str.toLowerCase(); // Every letter is now lowercase
str.concat(" ", "How is life"); // Returns the string with the concatenated part
str.split(" "); // This will convert the string to an array that is split with spaces (each word is an array element)
str.split(); // This makes an array of size 1 containing the whole string
str.split(""); // This splits the string every char

name: indexOf
info: Find the index of a substring.
content:
var str = "Hello world, welcome to the universe.";
var n = str.indexOf("welcome"); // Returns the start index (13)

name: Slice
info: Slice a part of the string
content:
var str = "Hello world!";
var res = str.slice(1, 5); // Returns substring (ello)
